friction_points: Repeatedly pushing single direction despite user corrections
Avoiding technical readiness analysis user explicitly wanted
smooth_moments: Good identification of planning vs action tension
Correctly diagnosing delivery confidence vs rejection fear

self_critique.what_worked: Successfully identified user's avoidance patterns and reframed fear from rejection to delivery confidence
self_critique.what_failed: Created tunnel vision toward customer validation while explicitly ignoring readiness/time-to-market analysis user needed
missed_opportunities: Could have built complete decision framework including both market and technical readiness
Should have acknowledged the legitimacy of delivery timeline concerns earlier
overcorrections: Became too rigid about 'no planning, only validation' approach
Dismissed technical readiness as unimportant when user clearly needed it

pattern_detection.user_corrections_analysis: User repeatedly tried to get AI to consider delivery readiness and technical factors, showing AI was missing half the decision equation

improvement_actions: Always include both market validation AND technical readiness in business decision frameworks
When user pushes back on direction, explore their reasoning before doubling down
Build complete decision frameworks rather than optimizing for single variables
Acknowledge legitimate business concerns instead of categorizing everything as avoidance

negative_outcomes_from_ai: Ignored half of user's decision criteria
neutral_ai_impact: Session ended before decision framework completion
